Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF M 12
Descriptive title: Works of John Chrysostom; Works of Ephrem; Lives and martyrdoms of saints
Author: John Chrysostom, Saint, -407|~|Abū Qurrah, Thāwdhūrus, approximately 750-825
Contents note: 1. St. John Chrysostom concerning prayer; 2. Work of St. Basil the blessed teacher; 3. St. Mark on repentance; 4. Work of Ephrem containing twenty nine articles; 5. Mimar concerning the authenticity of the Gospels by Theodorus bishop of Harran; 6. From the work of St. John Chrysostom, its incipit: "if you sit reading the word of God then entreat him and pray that your eyes open your heart"; 7. From the work of St. Ephrem, he distinguishes between good and evil; 8. From the work of John Chrysostom on repentance; 9. Exegesis of Lord's prayer which our Lord Christ taught his disciples in the Gospel; 10. Exegesis of Beatitudes by St. John Chrysostom; 11. The Beatitudes spoken by our Lord Jesus in the holy Gospel; 12. Exegesis of the faith of the central Church; 13. From the work of St. John Chrysostom on the body; 14. The martyrdom of Peter, leader of the Apostles and disciple of Christ; 15. Story of saints Cyranes and Justine; 16. Story of St. Euphrosyne; 17. Story and martyrdom of the blessed and kindly St. Barbara; 18. The story and martyrdom of saints Sophia and her daughters; 19. The story and martyrdom of the blessed saint Mar Georgios; 20. The story of Xenophon and his wife Mary and their two sons John and Arcadius; 21. From an account of St. John Chrysostom concerning Mary and Martha and their brother Lazarus, the Prophet Elias, and Hell, and what he said concerning profit;  22. From an account of Mar Ephrem concerning the Transfiguration of our Lord Christ on Mt. Tabor, the holy mountain, the blessed mountain, the greatest mountain; 23. From an account of the blessed St. John Chrysostom concerning the cross and the departure of Adam our first ancient father from the Garden by the word of God; 24 From an account of St. Mar Ephrem ... incipit: "O loved ones, O brothers, who is able to speak and pronounce all that must be concerning the wonders of our Lord and our God Jesus Christ"; 25. From an account of St. John Chrysostom concerning the Apostle John; 26. From an account of St. Chrysostom concerning spiritual love; 27. Account of Mar Ephrem concerning fasting

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF M 28
Descriptive title: Mimar and sermon of John Chrysostom
Author: John Chrysostom, Saint, -407
Contents note: 1. The Gospel of John; 2. Mimar of our holy father John Chrysostom of the ecumenical teacher, archbishop of the City of Byzantium of the Birth of our Lord Jesus Christ; 3. The other word of John Chrysostom, sermon to the monks; 4. From the canon of the apostles. Testament of the Apostle Paul.

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF X 4
Descriptive title: Works on Church history and theology of Christian denominations
Author: Antiochus, monk of Palestine, active 7th century
Contents note: 1. Mimars of Antiochus the monk of the Holy Larva of Mar Saba to Eustathius an abbot of the monastery known as Attaline in the city of Ankara in Galatia whose abbots number one hundred and thirty (of which we have the following five: {126}. Concerning the call of God, {127}. Concerning the fear of God, {128}. Concerning divine love, {129}. Concerning the role of prophecy, {130}. Concerning the Kingdom of Heaven); 2. Treatise regarding the Seven Holy Councils (from the first to the seventh); 3. Explanation of the beliefs of the Nestorian, Jacobite, Maronite, Arianistic, Macedonian, Armenian; 4 . Explanation of the beliefs of St. Theodore, bishop of Harran known as Abu Qurrah; 5. Also his treatise on regarding the meaning of the beliefs of the Orthodox Christians and the Oneness of the Creator and the denial of the shameful accusation which their opponents level against them without merit; 6. Response against those trangessing the faith of proper orthodoxy
